title: Scale-free test on swarm lesson citation graph
expect: Power-law degree distribution with alpha in [2.0, 3.0] (classical scale-free); ISO-8 confirmed
method: Parse all L-*.md for L-NNN citation patterns; build in-degree distribution; MLE fit power-law on non-zero tail (k_min=1)
actual: alpha=1.899. 57.8% orphan rate. Top hub: L-001 (10 cites). Tail is monotonically decreasing but alpha < 2.
diff: Expected alpha 2.0-3.0; actual 1.899 — just outside scale-free range. Zero-inflation (57.8%) is larger than expected. Tail is power-law-like but thinner hub than classical scale-free networks.

verdict.reason: alpha < 2.0 falls outside classical scale-free range. Zero-inflation (57.8%) violates preferential attachment assumption — most lessons are never cited, which breaks the rich-get-richer dynamic.
verdict.partial_confirmation: Hub lessons (L-001, L-304) do act as attractors — tail is consistent with weak preferential attachment. ISO-8 partially confirmed for the non-zero tail only.
verdict.ISO8_status: PARTIAL — power law holds for cited lessons (k>=1), but majority of lessons (58%) are never cited, which is not predicted by ISO-8

implications.compaction: Hub lessons (alpha < 2 means hubs dominate even more than in typical scale-free) — L-001, L-304 must be compaction-protected. Orphan 58% are safe to archive.
implications.citation_culture: Current low citation density prevents scale-free network formation. Target K_avg > 2 would likely produce true scale-free structure via preferential attachment.
implications.F-GT4_connection: Spectral clustering on a near-empty graph will not find meaningful clusters — need K_avg > 1 first.
